column4: careful - not all DNS servers ping these days - best to test with nslookup
never had that problem :)
an error message would be useful
are you using a custom kernel?
nope stock 686 - & I've tried the stock 386 too - I think something I installed has munged the init scripts, but dunno what
ok. is minix listed in /etc/modules? do you have a minix reference in /etc/fstab?
1/2 sec I'll check
also look for minix in /boot/grub/menu.lst
Pygi: could it be the initrd that is messed up?
I've tried 2 kernels, so I guess init is good
do both of them use the same initrd?
I though init was part of the kernel?
initrd loads modules into RAM before the real kernel takes over i think
yep, but that's part of /boot/initrd.img - -so it's different with each kernel
you got a kernel.stable option in grub to choose?
pretty sure it's not a kernel prob - because I have 2 different kernels - both crap out somewhere in /scripts/local-mounts
ok. hmm
so have a look at the scrips in /etc/init.d if you got a minix script in there, remove its executable bit.
yar, I think I just need to poke around a bit - thx for the help guys :)
np
atm eyalw doesn't even have Direct rendering enabled for his card...
